data.title: what's the behavior of custom attribute that set in editor
data.body:
Hi, all
I set a custom attribute to a node in the editor, but I can't read it by call node->GetAttribute(const String& name) in c++, this function says that "Could not find attribute xxx in Node", am I on the wrong way?
Thanks.

data.title: All math classes should have default initialization
data.body:
It's very bad practice to leave data members uninitialized in constructors. It will lead to undefined behaviour when the user is doing something that appears valid. For example:

Matrix4 myMatrix; //The members are not initialized

myMatrix.SetTranslation(MyVector); //Thinking that myMatrix is initialized to an identity, one will think this is correct. 

I know Matrix::IDENTITY exists for this purpose, but why the extra step when the constructor can do this itself?

data.title: Add temporal prefab/node browser with preview (to work with nodes)
data.body: Window in editor with a list of Objects/Nodes/Prefabs in folder Objects, and drag & drop or mouse preview of model/prefab like in RTS games editors (The 3D model or prefab view in the mouse pos in the map ground(like ghost))

data.title: Elapsed time in post process effects
editor angle script mem leak
OpenGL 3.x, OpenGL ES 3.x, Directx 9.x / 10.x (SM3) as minimun ?
data.body:
Because 3.x versions are now 5-6 years old and have better performance than 2.x and more options...
(Urho3D Website - Direct3D9 or OpenGL rendering (Shader Model 2, OpenGL 2.0 or OpenGL ES 2.0 required as minimum))

OpenGL 2.x (~2004 - 2008) Directx 9.x ( \* )
OpenGL 3.x (~2008 - 2010) Directx 10.x ( *\* )
OpenGL 4.x (~2010 - 2014) Directx 11.x ( **\* )
OpenGL 5.x (~2014 - 2015) Directx 12.x

The version of Directx 9.x is ok, because 10.x have bad performance in some cases.
*OpenGL 3.2, Directx 9.0c

data.title: Decoupling of BorderImage border screen pixel size and UVs
data.body:
Currently only the center patch of the BorderImage UI element can freely scale. In some cases it would be appropriate to also allow the borders to become non-pixel perfect as well, by defining a separate attribute for the borders' image (UV) size.

To not break compatibility with existing layouts and styles, this needs to be default off.

data.title: Editor entities icons & change axis models
data.body:
- Icons in the center of entities (light,model...) for fast selection and view of the pos of the entities.
- Change the 3D axis (rotate,move,scale) models and add virtual lines like blender or others.

data.title: Renderpath without scene passes
data.body: If a viewport contains a renderpath with no scene passes, it should not require a Scene / Octree / Camera to be present at all (currently if those are missing, it aborts the view rendering) and it should not do culling + batch collection at all.

data.title: Update LuaJIT
data.body:
LuaJIT 2.0.3 has been released on March 12th.
See changelogs: http://luajit.org/changes.html

data.title: Use viewport sized textures in postprocessing and deferred rendering
data.body:
When multiple smaller-than-screen viewports are rendered, any intermediate textures used in the postprocessing, as well as the G-buffer in deferred rendering uses a texture that is as large as the screen or destination texture, in which the viewport is positioned. This has the following disadvantages:
- Makes pingpong copies take more GPU bandwidth, as the whole screen is always copied
- Makes the viewport texture sampling more complex (it needs to take viewport position into account)
- Adjacent viewports "bleed" into each other in for example a bloom or blur shader

The reason this is done is to avoid allocation of several viewport-sized G-buffers in deferred rendering, but in this case the disadvantages outweigh that advantage and should be changed to use viewport sized textures instead.

data.title: Make more samples touch-friendly when run on mobile platform
data.body: With a few exceptions like NinjaSnowWar played via Urho3DPlayer and 02_HelloGUI, all the other samples do not respond to touch on mobile platform.

data.body: Slight change the editor will now draw the entire hierarchy's debug geometry for the selected node. I believe its more useful and brings the editor inline with other engine's editors, feel free to disagree.

data.title: Editor / Engine view render steps ?
data.body: Have the engine control/settings for view only for example the lit mode or other rendered passes (only normals, only textures, others) ?

data.title: Node ID attribute editing
data.body:
Some components contain references to other nodes as node ID attributes: Constraint, StaticModelGroup, SplinePath.

These should support, in the editor, dragging the desired node to the node ID field. Currently this can not work because initiating a drag in the editor hierarchy window switches away from the node you were just editing.

The connections could also be visualized as debug draw lines.

data.title: ParticleEmitter and ParticleEmitter2D don't share a common design.
data.body:
The 2D and 3D particle emitter components' APIs should match as closely as possible. Fixing this will simplify iteration (as switching between 2D and 3D particle emitters will be painless) and make the engine more intuitive.

Similarly, both components should both read/write the same format: ParticleEmitter reading .xml and ParticleEmitter2D reading a .plist dict is just weird.

data.title: Feeding audio data into SoundSource
data.body:
SoundSource should support feeding a continuous audio stream into it (for example a video file's audio track, or software synthesis produced by code).

The system already used by the on-the-fly Ogg Vorbis decoding could be expanded to support this.

EDIT: there could be at least the following streaming operation modes:
- SoundSource pulls the audio data in the mixing thread (this is what Ogg Vorbis playback uses)
- SoundSource pulls the audio data in the main thread (in SoundSource::Update())
- Application pushes audio data into SoundSource in the main thread; playback stops if there is an underrun and continues once there is data again.

data.title: Subscription issue in UI
data.body:
-- Click on left button to create a new button
-- Click on new button to remove it
-- Redo previous steps: button is not removed
-- 'Regression' introduced between commit f36041c and release 1.31
-- Maybe commit  98b924d9c5 needs investigation

require "LuaScripts/Utilities/Sample"
ui.root.defaultStyle = cache:GetResource("XMLFile", "UI/DefaultStyle.xml")

function Start()
    SampleStart()
    input.mouseVisible = true
    CreateButton()
end

function CreateCloseButton()
    button = ui.root:CreateChild("Button")
    button:SetStyleAuto()
    button.minHeight = 40
    button:SetPosition((graphics.width) / 2, 10)
    SubscribeToEvent(button, "Released", "HandleCloseButton")
end

function CreateButton()
    button2 = ui.root:CreateChild("Button")
    button2:SetStyleAuto()
    button2.minHeight = 40
    SubscribeToEvent(button2, "Released", "HandleButton")
end

function HandleCloseButton(eventType, eventData)
    button:Remove()
end

function HandleButton(eventType, eventData)
    CreateCloseButton()
end

data.title: Screenshots on Android
data.body: Taking, saving and displaying screenshots may be broken on Android. This needs investigation.

data.title: Expand Input keyboard API
data.body:
The functions from the following page dealing with key names and keycode / scancode mapping should be available in the Input subsystem.

http://wiki.libsdl.org/CategoryKeyboard

Also it should be possible to query for keys down based on scancode, and include the scancode in key events.

data.title: Skybox returned in raycast result
data.body:
Performing a RaycastSingle on PhysicsWorld, a skybox is returned in raycast result.
For example, if we modify Touch.lua:
if result ~= nil then print("Physics raycast hit " .. result.body:GetNode().name) end
instead of:
if result.body ~= nil then print("Physics raycast hit " .. result.body:GetNode().name) end
we get an error (as there is no RigidBody), indicating that result is not nil.

data.title: Batch render for 2D object
data.body: Auto combine 2D objects with same texture and blend mode together.

data.title: Baking tiff files into dds files using metadata
data.body:
Allow people to run commands based on the metadata [Instructions Field](http://www.photometadata.org/meta-resources-field-guide-to-metadata#Instructions) in a tiff file. This allows you to read the file and then bake them into dds files based on your instructions. 

Example instructions:

```
/autooptimizefile=0 /bumpblur=0 /bumpblur_a=0 /bumpstrength=5 /bumpstrength_a=5 /bumptype=0 /bumptype_a=0 /dither=0 /M=50,50,50,50,50,50 /mc=0 /mipgamma=0 /mipmaps=1 /mipnormalize=0 /ms=35 /pixelformat=DXT5 /preset=Diffuse_highQ /reduce=-2
```

 What sort of syntax would be good?
